item.title: What are your thoughts on marijuana legilization?
item.dc:creator: @EcoPS_GM EcoPS GM
item.description:
@EcoPS_GM wrote:

I’m all for the recreational use of any drug, personally. People know good and well what they are doing could cause harm upon themselves or others, depending on the severity of the drug, and the setting they currently reside in. I read something that a small town in America has actually done something somewhat similar. They have a governmental rehabilitation system in place. Anyone who comes to turn themselves in will have all of their drugs confiscated and they will be placed in the rehabilitation system, not being charged with anything. According to the article, it has saved the city far more money than what the ‘war on drugs’ has cost. Unfortunately, for anyone interested, I do not attain the source to this article, nor do I remember the town’s name.

Read full topic
item.source: What are your thoughts on marijuana legilization?

item.title: What are your thoughts on marijuana legilization?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:5, topic:553936”][quote author=Justin Bieber link=topic=672858.msg4499458#msg4499458 date=1448369900]
Should be kept illegal otherwise people get high and run over innocent pedestrians then OD and end up in the ER wasting taxpayers money
[/quote]
We really don’t need your trolling here.

Legalisation saves/earns the state money, and the most dangerous thing about lighter drugs is being caught.[/quote]
Legalization saved me from getting 2 felonys and a misdemeanor.

Not only that, in the first couple of months of it being legal in my state, it raised over the amount of money to go to schools (The first $1 million of tax revenue from pot in my state goes to schools automatically).

And then you have this:
http://www.forbes.com/sites/debraborchardt/2015/09/16/colorados-pot-tax-revenues-are-higher-than-alcohols/

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

“Debates” section has gone over this, I believe.

But, should be legalized. All drugs should be legalized. Prohibition prevents nothing. Education on issues, effects, etc. and safe usage are key.
